page.title: 09View from Charlton Hill
page.content: The landscape is best seen from the high point of Charlton Hill. From here it is possible to see for miles across open countryside. There are few houses visible and the farm land and trees stretch away in the distance. The ground slopes gently down from Charlton Hill to the valley of the River Severn. Then there is a steady rise in the ground up to the long wooded outline of Wenlock Edge. This leads on to the higher hills of Church Stretton in the distance. Turning slightly to the west it is just possible to make out the church spires of Shrewsbury but the buildings of the town are too far away to be seen clearly. The landscape must have changed little for many years.
